result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan M. Melcher

defendant.name: Melcher, Ryan M.
defendant.address: P O Box 505  1320 Main St, Stevens Point, WI 54481

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
State files Information.
State indicates that this case will be DRI.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.
Bond Continued.

Defendant Ryan M. Melcher in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:04 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

Defendant Ryan M. Melcher in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

Atty Cousins asks the bond be continued. 
Atty Drengler indicates there was a stipulation and order re: bond. 
Clerk notes the stipulation was filed today.   
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
  Do not possess/consume controlled substances illegally.
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances.
Comply with Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.
Follow all non-monetary conditions of all outstanding files.

DA Louis Molepske appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

DA Molepske states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $600 cash bond with conditions as stated.
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:    @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch
